author: Jack Davis
title: Krauthammer: Trump’s Ground-Breaking Style Has ‘Weaponized Twitter’
text:
Supreme Court: Obama Violated Constitution With Appointee Who Bypassed Senate Confirmation 
Krauthammer has noted before that Trump’s tweets are effective 
“I mean if they weren’t, they wouldn’t be using them. … It works. It has a lot of effect,” he said, later adding that “What Trump is doing is wielding a two-by-four.” 
After an intemperate Trump tweet, “An epidemic of constitutional chin tugging and civil libertarian hair pulling immediately breaks out. By the time the media have exhausted their outrage over the looming abolition of free speech, judicial supremacy and affordable kale, Trump has moved on,” he wrote in January. Advertisement - story continues below “Trump will continue to tweet and the media will continue take the bait. Highly entertaining but it is a sideshow. Congress is where the fate of the Trump presidency will be decided,” Krauthammer added then. But earlier this week, Krauthammer noted that Trump took his unique style right into the halls of Congress when he confronted Rep. Mark Meadows, R-N.C., during a meeting with House Republicans. During that meeting, Trump told Meadows, “I’m gonna come after you, but I know I won’t have to, because I know you’ll vote ‘Yes.'” 
Trump kept his focus on the House Freedom Caucus chairman during the session, saying, “I think Mark Meadows will get on board, too. … Because honestly, a loss is not acceptable, folks.” 
When Meadows at one point told Trump that the president’s Mar-A-Lago estate, which he visited last weekend, was very nice, Trump replied, “I guess it wasn’t lovely enough” because Meadows was still a “no” on the bill. 
“He said essentially you better come aboard. He did it with a smile, he did it with a joke, [but] I think he means it,” Krauthammer said. Advertisement - story continues below
